description: From Middle French infect, from Latin infectus, perfect passive participle of inficiō (“dye, taint”).

verbs.description: infect (third-person singular simple present infects, present participle infecting, simple past and past participle infected)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To bring (the body or part of it) into contact with a substance that causes illness (a pathogen), so that the pathogen begins to act on the body; (of a pathogen) to come into contact with (a body or body part) and begin to act on it.
examples: Not everyone will be infected when an epidemic strikes.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To contaminate (an object or substance) with a pathogen.
(transitive) To make somebody enthusiastic about one's own passion, or to communicate a feeling to others, or a feeling communicating itself to others.
examples: Her passion for dancing has infected me.
